selection_reasoning: I am carrying forward the stable champion (5_2) and its successful variants (8_4, 6_4). Gen 9 demonstrated that the 'Hybrid LP' approach is currently failing, likely due to infeasibility issues or solver timeouts. The next generation will focus on 'Conservative Scaling'—increasing the search depth of the successful trial_5_2 framework without introducing the unstable LP-radii component.

trial_selections.reasoning: Highest score (2.6330). It remains the most stable and effective framework. All Gen 9 attempts to refine it with LP-based local search or Differential Evolution either failed or returned 0.0, suggesting the LP-radii approach is currently too unstable in this implementation.
Best adaptive variant (2.628). It provides a robust alternative to the fixed step-size of 5_2 and is less prone to the 'INVALID' errors seen in the LP-hybrid attempts.
Best compression-based score (2.616). Maintains algorithmic diversity.
